name: Mount Monadnock

trails_config.name: White Dot & White Cross Loop
trails_config.description: One of the most climbed mountains in the world. From Monadnock State Park, ascend the White Dot Trail steeply toward the bald summit, where expansive views of New England unfold (the best reward for minimal elevation). Descend via the slightly longer White Cross Trail to complete a loop. The granite summit provides an incredible 360° panorama spanning into five states on a clear day. Sunrise and sunset hikes here are legendary. Expect crowds on nice weekends, but the experience is iconic for hikers of all ages.
trails_config.parking_info: Monadnock State Park Headquarters, Poole Rd

current_conditions.ai_summary: One of New Hampshire's premier peaks, Mount Monadnock rises to 3170 feet. It is known for its rugged terrain and panoramic vistas.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 3170 feet, Mount Monadnock is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **White Dot & White Cross Loop**, a **4.2 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **local peak challenge**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

This peak stands relatively isolated, offering a solitary summit experience.

logistics.parking_info: Monadnock State Park Headquarters, Poole Rd
